{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-08-03T03:38:32.000Z", "description": "Who We Are

At Aurora, we\u2019re on a mission to deliver the benefits of self-driving technology safely, quickly, and broadly. It all starts with the Aurora Driver, a platform created from industry-leading hardware and software and designed to adapt across a variety of vehicle types and industries.

We\u2019re led by a team of self-driving luminaries, and we\u2019ve forged strategic partnerships with leading transportation companies\u2014including ride-hailing network Uber, truck-manufacturers PACCAR and Volvo Trucks, and the world\u2019s largest automaker Toyota\u2014setting us up to deliver the Aurora Driver in both trucks and passenger vehicles. We are funded by Amazon, Uber, T Rowe Price, and some of Silicon Valley\u2019s best venture capital firms, including Sequoia, Greylock, and Index Ventures.

Aurora is in the best position to lead the self-driving space with a team of unparalleled depth and expertise, the technology to deliver, and the partnerships to build a transformative business for the long-term.

Aurora hires talented people with diverse backgrounds who are ready to help build a transportation ecosystem that will make our roads safer, get crucial goods where they need to go, and make mobility more efficient and accessible for all.

In this role, you will
  • Take a leading role in analyzing the autonomy capabilities of a self-driving system from a safety perspective
  • Develop first-principle analytic models to characterize and predict the complex, non-linear physics and interactions in self-driving
  • Analyze multi-agent interactions between road users and the self-driving vehicle to ensure safe system response
  • Develop data-driven strategies to complement analytical models and provide statistical justification
  • Develop simulation strategy to verify these models for safe behavior
  • Rapid prototype controls and dynamics models for self-driving vehicles and develop simulation approach to evaluate the models
  • Develop safety requirements from the analyses, working with stakeholders
  • Collaborate with systems, hardware, and software subject-matter-experts to analyze controls and dynamics impact of safety concepts and mechanisms to achieve safety goals


Required Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or related discipline preferred
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience working in systems engineering
  • Ability to demonstrate a proven track record of successfully working with large, complex teams in a results-driven environment
  • Ability to model complex systems by using kinematics and multi-body dynamics
  • Ability to derive technical engineering requirements from analytical and data models
  • Comfortable working with ambiguity and evolving priorities
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills


Desirable Qualifications (this Section Is Optional)
  • Experience with complex autonomous systems
  • Working knowledge of Python and physical modeling and simulation tool (e.g., MatLab)
  • Experience with Machine Learning


Working at Aurora

At Aurora, we bring together people with extraordinary talent and experience united by the strength of our values. We operate with integrity, set outrageous goals, and continue to build a culture where we win together\u2014all without any jerks.

Benefits

We also offer a competitive benefits package that supports the whole you, including

We have offices in Pittsburgh, Mountain View, San Francisco, Bozeman, Dallas and Seattle.
  • Competitive salary, bonus and RSU package
  • Premium choices for Medical, vision, and dental
  • 401k benefits
  • Life and disability benefits
  • 18 weeks paid leave for new parents and caregivers
  • Flexible vacation and company paid holidays
  • Fertility benefits through Carrot
  • Working from home support
  • Professional growth and mentorship opportunities through the Aurora Academy
  • Wellness Platforms (Spring Health, Headspace, Aaptiv, Quit Genius)

We believe that self-driving technology has broad benefits \u2013 including an increase in safety and access to transportation \u2013 and to achieve those benefits, we want and need a workforce with diverse experiences, insights, and perspectives; said another way, a workforce that reflects the communities and people our technology will benefit.

About Aurora

Founded in 2017, Aurora was started by industry luminaries, and now we\u2019re a team with a multitude of perspectives and experiences. Chris Urmson helped lead Carnegie Mellon\u2019s efforts in Darpa\u2019s Grand Challenges, then was a founding member of Google\u2019s self-driving team. Sterling Anderson worked on the tech at MIT before leading Tesla\u2019s Model X and Autopilot programs.
